title: Artifacts in editor background - macOS X
body:
Is the known problem of background artifacts in the editor back? 

[https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/75171](url)

I have problems with the 1.39 Insider (2019-09-17T05:59:55.803Z) as well as with the 1.39 Exploration Build (2019-09-13T06:37:35.080Z). I'm using a special color profile. A change to another profile doesn't change anything.

Since it doesn't appear in the stable build it will probably be the problem of Electron (this time version 6) again, right?

title: [SCSS] nested properties with shorthand values break syntax highlighting

title: SCM: Display current line length for source control commit message input

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
HI! I care a lot for 50/72 commit message rule and I depend a lot on VSCode's source control's commit message input.
The problem is that I always start to write, and I wait for the warning to appear, then if I'm in title, (first line), I try to change what I intended to say to contain only 50 chars; and if I'm in description (lines after the break after the first line) I write as much as I get the warning, and then I go back to before the current word and insert a new line there (press enter). This pattern is becoming so annoying. I want to observe how much I'm writing on the current line. A screen shot of what I have in mind:

![Screenshot from 2019-09-17 11-14-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5755214/65018035-614a4300-d93d-11e9-9db9-7839d97c67d3.png)

(note the small number in bottom right corner of the screen)

title: Enter in the middle of a line comment should create a new line comment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug I'm using JavaScript but this is likely not language-specific: 1. Start typing a comment ` // something like, if ( true ) ` 2. Type an opening brace ` // something like, if ( true ) {` 3. Editor will insert a closing brace, cursor will be between braces ` // something like, if ( true ) {|}` 4. Hit Enter / Return **Expected:** Newline will automatically be in a commented-out line ``` // something like, if ( true ) { // } ``` **Actual:** The comment is treated like code and an extra newline is inserted, introducing a hanging end-brace: ``` // something like, if ( true ) { } ``` VS Code version: Code 1.38.0 (3db7e09f3b61f915d03bbfa58e258d6eee843f35, 2019-09-03T21:47:00.464Z) OS version: Darwin x64 17.7.0

title: CustomExecution2 Feedback: expose variable resolvers
body:
One shortcoming I realized with CustomExecution2 is that each task would have to implement their own way of resolving common variables--e.g. ${workspaceFolder} or ${file}, etc.

Can we get an API to reach the variable resolvers e.g. [ConfigurationResolverService](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/afffb1e7a77664632e1e6a5079b7e419f015ab1f/src/vs/workbench/services/configurationResolver/browser/configurationResolverService.ts#L300)? This way any variable input to CustomExecution2 tasks would not require the task to reimplement the wheel.

title: Reference / schema loading problem behind kerberos authenticated proxy
body:
Hello,

I have problem loadind JSON references / schemas behind corporate kerberos authenticated proxy.

VS Code reports:

Problems loading reference 'https://schemastore.azurewebsites.net/schemas/json/tsconfig.json'
Unable to load schema from 'https://schemastore.azurewebsites.net/schemas/json/tsconfig.json'

or

Unable to load schema from 'http://json.schemastore.org/tslint'


Followed by the HTML error message returned by the proxy server itself: Authentication required

The rest of features of VSC are working fine (extension/market place browsing) so I think that some specific method is used to load references from the web and the Chromium proxy settings are not used.

Please note there is not fallback to NTLM or Basic authentication allowed on the proxy server, just kerberos.

Version: 1.38.1 (system/user),
I notice the problem is there at least since 1.26.

I didn't find any other related issue and I think this one is not covered by #79044 or by #74991.

title: Can't turn off IntelliSense explain mode - Poor UX
body:
When I accidentally enter IntelliSense explain mode I'm unable to leave it unless I reload the workspace.

Regarding to [this](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/75500#issuecomment-507172728) I should be able to toggle back with `Ctrl/Cmd+/` but it doesn't work. Maybe it's related to my German keyboard layout.

Neither can I find a command in the command palette to toggle back nor can I find a setting to turn it off permanently.
I think this feature should be disabled by default. Or it should at least provide a hint on how to go back to standard IntelliSense.

title: Add a system wide settings.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I think a system wide `settings.json` could be very useful. When code starts, it should load system wide settings, then user settings, and at the end workspace settings. So that workspace settings will have priority over user settings, and those over system settings.

I think this could be useful for large deployments or multi-user systems managed by an administrator. In our case, we are trying to deploy vscode for around 100 computers and +1000 users for a University, in both Windows and GNU/Linux (Debian). I think a file in `/etc/` for windows could be great, and something similar for Windows.

title: Fix scrolling behavior in menu while zoomed in
body: Fixes #80047

title: Default Output Colorizer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
The [Output Colorizer](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=IBM.output-colorizer) extension adds syntax highlighting to the output panel.  However, other extensions (e.g. Code runner) can cause conflicts, removing the syntax highlighting.

Apparently [this is a limitation with VSCode](https://github.com/IBM-Cloud/vscode-log-output-colorizer/issues/19#issuecomment-392048256) itself. I'm not exactly sure what needs to be done here to get extensions to play nicely. I suppose we would need to be able to select a default colorizer?

title: MFA support for encrypting credentials in extensions (SSH accounts, etc.)
body: It would be pretty sweet if VSCode had a mechanism for extensions to encrypt saved credentials, using whatever the user's platform supports - Hello, Hello for Business, smart cards, FIDO, etc.

title: Multiline editor find doesn't work in regex mode
body:
- Have an editor with

```
a
b
```

- Copy and paste it into the find widget
- Enable regex mode
- It is not found

You could argue that a regex shouldn't contain a real newline, but I had the same issue in search and found that people expected it to work, so it works in search.

title: [emmet] http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" in 2019

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
`html:5` macro still includes `<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="ie=edge">`
According to all the sources, it should be definitely unneeded nowadays.
This has been previously reported in #58796, where issue was locked and limited to collaborators. It was marked as upstream and suggested opening an issue at emmetio/expand-abbreviation (now archived). However https://github.com/emmetio/expand-abbreviation/issues/28 shows that is has already been disabled there.
Why is it still kept in VSCode?

title: Search and replaced for almost 380+ files in my project overwrites the files to 0 bytes and the code base disappeared
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.38.0
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on the Search icon, used search and replace in the project root directory
2. Code base in all the files were truncated and nothing found further

Search identified nearly 385 files. When tried to replace, the vscode editor became unresponsive. Now all my entire week's work is gone. Unable to recover the code base in any way. This is the first time happened in my first time during the 8 years of my IT experience. Been using Vscode since past 6 months.

How am i able to answer to my boss & client. They will never get convinced with my explanation.

The error is similar to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/71489

No solution found

body: Issue Type: Bug I use "Toggle Editor Window" to quickly give me a full-screen terminal. However, the input focus is not on terminal after toggling. I have to click in the window or execute "Toggle Integrated Terminal" to get focus there. Please let input focus switch to the maximized panel. VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

title: Ability to disable language features provided by extensions
body:
Some languages are supported by multiple extensions that provide an overlapping set of language features.

Seems like much effort has been done to support this use case. For some features, the provider's 'score' is used to select which provider to use (e.g. for formatting and syntax highlighting). For other features, results from all providers are merged (e.g. completion, hover, definition, problems, symbols).

My problem is that in some cases I would like to choose which features to use from which extension. For example, I have three extensions that provide overlapping language features for Python: Microsoft's Python, pyright, and mypy extensions. 
 * For hovers, I only like the ones provided by the Python extension (it supports showing documentation while the others don't). Seeing hovers from all three extensions is distracting.
 * For error reporting, I would like to see only the ones from mypy. It is possible to filter the problems view, but it's annoying to filter every time, and filtering just for 'mypy' will ignore errors from other languages I have in my workspace. Without filtering, many duplicate errors are shown.
 * For 'go to definition' and code completion, I would like to use only pyright. By default, results from all three extensions are shown – this requires multiple clicks for every 'go to definition' call because results slightly differ between extensions, so they are shown side by side instead of immediately jumping to the definition.

One solution is to ask every extension author to provide options for disabling some features. This is already done by some extensions but AFAIK not by most. It can be solved centrally by allowing users to selectively disable language features provided by extensions. Something similar has [already been implemented](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/41882) for formatting, using a dedicated setting. I think it should be extended to other language features. 

Something like:
```json
"languageFeatures.[extension].goToDefinition.enabled": false
```

By default all features from all extensions would be enabled.

title: Autosave file after resolve merge conflicts
body:
It would be great if after resolve a git conflict inside vscode, accepts or deny the incoming changes the editor autosave the file without the need to press Control/Command + S.

Will save a lot of headaches since will avoid pushing files without fix.

title: Can't run NPM SCRIPTS when using WSL as default shell
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1903

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open integrated terminal and set default to WSL
2.  Open a NodeJS project with at least one task in the `package.json` file
3.  Try to run any of the tasks, you'll get "The terminal process terminated with exit code: 1"

If you set your integrated terminal to CMD.EXE this will work perfectly (if you have nodejs for windows installed, of course)

Apparently it's trying to send `/d /c npm run` parameters to the shell, which are not supported by WSL executable. Tried setting `terminal.integrated.shell.windows` to "wsl" and it throws:
> The terminal process command 'wsl/d /c npm run front' failed to launch (exit code: {2})
 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes

title: Support QuickDiffProvider without SourceControl

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I have a requirement to show a quick diff on a document from a custom TextDocumentContentProvider. Currently the only way to do this is to create a new SourceControl which also affects the Source Control UI.

Is it possible to expose a quickDiffProvider property on either a document or editor level so its possible to use without affecting the Source Control UI.

title: Enable crash reporting on the extension host process
body:
* this is only possible once we adopt Electron 6, in Electron 4 we get the error `Cannot initialize out-of-process crash handler` on Windows.
  * This is possible in Electron 6 because it has adopted crashpad for crash reporting on windows, which aligns with what Chromium was doing.
* this can be implemented easily by defining the crash reporter options for the extension host [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/9b0b5968ad18afe511bde480b6dfb04e48ebc377/src/vs/workbench/services/extensions/electron-browser/extensionHost.ts#L165)

fyi @bpasero

title: Configure git-gutter patch preview / actions side and add copy shortcut
body: Would it be possible to have the action buttons on the other side of the gutter view? You click on the left side of the editor. If you want to revert the change or, move to the next change you have to move the pointer all the way to the right. Also it would be very useful to be able to copy directly from this action bar if you removed code, as a shortcut for the quick action in the window.

title: Build: update node to 12
body: I reverted the build related changes for node via https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/254f6835b73bf7c868dc965649072144530be2b8 but we should eventually consider to bump our node.js version for building to the latest 12.x once we are confident with Electron 6.

title: "editor font zoom" does not persist

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
- VSCode Version:1.38
- OS Version:Win 10

"Editor font zoom in" and "out" does not persist.  This is inconsistent with "view zoom" which does persist.  I understand that this is basically a shortcut to the "editor.fontSize" setting, but in that same vein, view zoom is just a shortcut to change the "window.zoom level" setting

Duplicate
1. "editor: font zoom out"
2. close & restart
3. font will have reverted pre-zoom size

Edit: updated title and text to reflect correct command "editor font zoom in/out"
